rationale: The documentation includes the patient's reported nausea as a side effect of lithium, noting the timing (morning) and improvement with food.
The patient's concern about long-term effects of lithium is noted, but there is no mention of the clinician's plan to monitor levels closely.
The patient's support system is documented, specifically mentioning the partner's role in providing support and reminders.
There is no mention of potential adjustments to lithium dosage or timing if nausea persists.
The clinician's advice to take lithium with food to mitigate nausea is documented.
There is no follow-up plan or further assessment of the patient's bipolar disorder management included.
